Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up! ([Rarity] Winter, winter)
'Cause tomorrow spring is here
'Cause tomorrow spring is here!

speaker: Applejack
text:
No easy task to clear the ground
Plant our tiny seeds
With proper care and sunshine
Everyone it feeds
Apples, carrots, celery stalks
Colorful flowers too
We must work so very hard

speaker: Golden Harvest
Applejack
Cherry Berry
text: It's just so much to do!

speaker: Choir
text:
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!
Let's finish our holiday cheer
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!
'Cause tomorrow spring is here
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: 'Cause tomorrow spring is here

speaker: Choir
text: 'Cause tomorrow spring is here!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text:
Now that I know what they all do
I have to find my place
And help with all of my heart
Tough task ahead I face
How will I do without my magic
Help the Earth pony way
I wanna belong so I must
Do my best today,
Do my best today!

speaker: Choir
text:
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!
Let's finish our holiday cheer
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!
'Cause tomorrow spring is here
Winter Wrap Up! Winter Wrap Up!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text:
'Cause tomorrow spring is here
'Cause tomorrow spring is here
'Cause tomorrow spring is here!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Everypony belongs to a team. What should *I* do? Where should *I* go?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: All right team, you're clear for takeoff.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Rainbow Dash!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh, hey Twilight, what's up?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What are *you* doing?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sending off one of my flight crews to retrieve the birds that have flown south for the winter.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, can I help? How about if I help clear out the clouds?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Um...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Right. No wings.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sorry, Twilight.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [gasp] Great, now what do we do?

speaker: Spike
text: I don't know about you, but I'm gonna be nappin'. [snore]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Come on Spike, this is serious business. Winter needs to be wrapped up, and I'm determined to do my part. Somehow.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Rarity, please tell me there's something, *anything* I can help you with.

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, how would you like to help create Ponyville's finest birds' nests?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Birds' nests?

speaker: Rarity
text: Why yes. When the weather team guides the birds back north for the spring, they'll need a place to live and lay their eggs.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Wow, Rarity, that one's really beautiful.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh why, thank you most sincerely. Would you like to try your hoof at a nest?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Would I*? Yes! Where do I begin?

speaker: Rarity
text: Okay. Now... uh, take some of that straw and hay over there, and a little bit of branch. Now, weave them through there, *yes*. Uh, take some ribbon, *yes*, oh uh, n... not there, oooh, yes, uh, tuck it in over there, uh but be careful not to... I don't know I guess that would do... oh dear.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *There*! It looks just like... yours. Oh my.

speaker: Spike
text: That nest needs to be condemned.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Spa-ha-hike, it's not so bad, ah, maybe birds can use it as a...

speaker: Spike
text: An outhouse?

speaker: Rarity
text: *Spike*. It's just fine. It's just a little rough around the edges. Let me lend you a hoof. Let's just untie this ribbon, and let me take out these sticks here, we'll shave this... [mumbling]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Hw...

speaker: Spike
text: I think we lost her.

speaker: Rarity
text: Ah, and we need to weave the string...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hellooooooo, Twilight! Wheeeeeeee!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Wow, Pinkie Pie, you're quite the skater. Probably the best skater I've ever seen.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Thanks Twilight, I've been doing this since I was an itty-bitty little-wittle Twinkie-Pinkie. Just comes natural. Which is probably why they designated me the lake scorer. I cut lines in the lakes with my skates. That way, when the rest of the weather team comes here to break the ice, it'll be easy as *pie*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: How clever. When the thick ice begins to melt, it'll break along the lines. Well, you sure have a lot of work ahead of you, there's quite a few lakes in Ponyville.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ha, tell me about it. Hey, Twilight, wanna help me out?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Would I*?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Come on, put on those skates over there. I bet you'll be a natural too.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Okay.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yaaaaay! [cheers]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Uh... maybe on second thought.

speaker: Spike
text: What are you talking about? You said you wanted to be helpful.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yippie!

speaker: Spike
text: Now get out there.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh no, whoa, wow...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Twilight, steer! Steer!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Yaaaaa!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh boy...

speaker: Spike
text: Pwuh.

speaker: Spike
text: Ha ha, you are a natural, Twilight. A natural *disaster*. [laughter]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Twilight, you did a great job your first time around. I'm sure my first time was just as wobbly and bobbly and crasheriffic as yours.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Really*?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But did I make you feel better?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Mm-hmm, yeah, I guess.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I think you'll be super awesome at something that keeps your hooves on the ground. I know, Fluttershy could probably use your help with the critters.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well... I'm pretty good with little animals. Yeah, I'll go help *her*.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh... it's, ah, that a-way.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Yaaaaaa!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Wake up, little sleepy heads. Hope you had some wonderful dreams and restful hibernation, but it's time to get up now, spring is coming.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Awww, how cute.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Aren't they? This is my favorite task the whole season, when I get to see all my little animal friends again.

speaker: Spike
text: Uh, what's "hibernation"?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: It's like a long sleep.

speaker: Spike
text: *Long sleep*?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: *Yes*. [bell rings] Wake up, little porcupines. Animals often hibernate through the winter to save their energy and eat less food.

speaker: Spike
text: I definitely like the idea of hibernation, uh, except for the "eat less food" part.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, would you just look at all these warrens and dens? I'm worried that I won't be able to wake up every animal before spring comes.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, I'll help, Fluttershy.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: You *will*? Oh, that would be wonderful.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Okay, let's start there.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Hello? Wake up little friends, wherever you are. Spring is coming. [bell rings] I wonder which cute little furry creatures I've awoken.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Waaa! Snakes! Snakes! [scream] Ugh! [grunt] [scream] Ugh!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Good morning, friends.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [sigh] All this Winter Wrap Up stuff is a lot harder than it looks.

speaker: Spike
text: [nasally] Right, because there's no magic. Why don't you just use *magic*, Twilight, and get it done the right way?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: No, Spike, I have to do it the traditional way. Ponyville has never needed magic to wrap up winter.

speaker: Spike
text: [nasally] Well, they never had *you* here before, either. Think how much quicker they could wrap up winter with your magic.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: No, no, *no*! I'm gonna find some other way that I can help out if it kills me. [grunt]

speaker: Applejack
text: Keep pushin', Caramel. That's it, Bumpkin. I know it's hard work, but you guys are doin' great. Yee-haw!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Hey, Applejack. How's everything going?

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh, just *dandy*. A little slow startin', but peachy all the same. There's a lot of ground to clear, ya hear? We can't even start the plantin' and the waterin' until we git all these heap a' snow hightailed outta here.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, I'd like to help.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, I... I dunno Twilight.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Just give me a *chance*.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, I never turn down a hard worker, but...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [struggle] Ugh... [struggle] Ugh... [gasp]

speaker: Spike
text: *Think of how much quicker they could wrap up winter with your magic.*

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I *could* use a come-to-life spell. Hwww... Here goes...

speaker: Applejack
text: Hmm. She's awful strong for such a little pony.

speaker: Spike
text: That's my girl, following my advice.

speaker: Applejack
text: And what in tarnation does that mean?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [gasp] Uh-oh. Slow down. *Slow down*!

speaker: Applejack
Spike
text: Whoa-oa-oa!

speaker: Applejack
text: What's going on? Wha'd'ya do? You used magic, didn't you?

speaker: Applejack
text: Nuts, Twilight, *you used magic*.

speaker: Spike
text: The *nerve*. Can you believe her?

speaker: Applejack
text: That's not how we do it 'round here, Twilight, and especially not on MAH farm.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, see, I just wanted to... [whine]

speaker: Spike
text: Come on, Twilight. Come on out.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm a winter mess up.

speaker: Spike
text: Well you're good at a lot of things, just not nest-making, ice-skating, animal-waking, snow-clearing.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [whine] Thanks a lot for making me feel *so* much better.

speaker: Spike
text: That's what I'm here for, sister.

speaker: Applejack
text: Rainbow Dash, y'all on the weather team need to melt the rest of the snow here on the ground and the trees, pronto.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Got it.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Wait. My poor little animals' homes will get flooded if the snow melts too fast.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Got it.

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm tellin' you, Rainbow, you gotta melt that snow *now*.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No, you simply must wait.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Okay.

speaker: Applejack
text: Go.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Stop.

speaker: Applejack
text: *Go*.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: *Stop*.

speaker: Applejack
text: GO!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: STOP!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Ugh! Make up your minds!

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: Oh! What in Equestria are all you arguing about? This sort of silliness is why we were *late* for spring *last year*, and the year before that, and the year before *that*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Did she say *late*?

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: I was hoping my amazingly inspirational speech would urge everyone to do better than last year, but now it looks like we're going to be later than *ever*. I mean just look at this catastrophe. The ice scorers made the ice chunks too big to melt. The nest designer is horrendously behind, we need several hundred, and she's only made *one.*

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And don't get me started on all the clouds in the sky, the icicles on the trees... This isn't good, *not* at *all*!

speaker: Applejack
text: And it's gonna be all to pieces disastrous if we can't get our seeds all planted.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Chillax Applejack, we're bustin' our chops as fast as we can.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No, not *fast*, we have to wake animals *slowly*.

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Uh, AJ?

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh good gravy, Caramel lost the grass seeds again, didn't he?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Rainbowshine
text: [grunt] Ditzy Doo accidentally went *north* to get the *southern* birds!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh that featherbrain. Didn't she learn her lesson last year when she went west?

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: Stop this at once. We don't have time to argue. It's almost sundown. Spring is going to be late again. Another year of scandal and shame. If only we could be *more organized*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Spike! Get my checklist and clipboard, STAT!

speaker: Spike
text: Eh, yes, ma'am.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Stop, everypony!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Stop!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Sorry. I know you all want to complete your jobs on time, but arguing is no way to go about it. What you need is *organization*, and I'm just the pony for the job.

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: I can't believe it. Spring is here! *On time*! And we have you to thank for it. If it weren't for your organizing skills we would still be arguing.

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It was a team effort.

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And since you helped every team, we have an official vest for you. We give you the title, "All-Team Organizer".

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Gosh, I don't even know what to say. Thank you, everypony.

speaker: Mayor Mare
text: And hereby I declare that winter is... wrapped up *on time*.

speaker: Applejack
text: Spike's sure gonna be in for a hog-sized surprised when that last piece a' ice melts.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Dear Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Winter Wrap Up was one of the most special things I've ever been a part of here in Ponyville. It helped me to learn we all have hidden talents, and if we're patient and diligent, we're sure to find them, and as always, with good friendship and teamwork, ponies can accomplish anything.* How's that, Spike? *Spike*?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, Spike. [laughter]

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Let's quiet down please. We have a very important lesson to get to. [class quiets down] Thank you. Today we are going to be talking about cutie marks.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Bo-ring. [sigh]

speaker: Cheerilee
text: You can all see my cutie mark, can't you? Like all ponies, I wasn't born with a cutie mark. My flank was blank.

speaker: Twist
text: Aww...! She's so precious!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Then one day, when I was about your age, I woke up to find that a cutie mark had appeared.

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Yes I know, but honestly, that's how everypony was wearing their mane back then. I had decided to become a teacher, and the flowers symbolized my hope that I could help my future students bloom if I nurture them with knowledge. The smiles represented the cheer I hope to bring to my little ponies while they were learning. Now, can anyone tell me when a pony gets his or her cutie mark?

speaker: Twist
text: Oh! Oh! Oh! When she discovers that certain something that makes her special!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: That's right, Twist. A cutie mark appears on a pony's flank when he or she finds that certain something that makes them different from every other pony. Discovering what makes you unique isn't something [Diamond Tiara: Pssst!] that happens overnight, and no amount of hoping, wishing, [Diamond Tiara: Pssst!] or begging, would make a cutie mark appear before its time.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Pssst!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: What?!

speaker: Cheerilee
text: Apple Bloom! Are you passing a note?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Uh, I... Um...

speaker: Cheerilee
text: What could be so important that it couldn't wait until after class? [gasp] It's blank.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: [laughter] Remind you of anypony? [laughter]

speaker: Twist
text: Want some sweets? I've got some peppermint sticks. I made them myself.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Mm-mm.

speaker: Twist
text: They'll make you smi-i-le.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: No...

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: I don't know why we had to sit through a lecture about getting a cutie mark. I mean, waiting for your cutie mark is sooo last week. You got yours, I just got mine. We all have them already. [gasp] I mean, almost all of us have them already. Don't worry, you two, you're still totally invited to my cute-ceañera this weekend.

speaker: Silver Spoon
text: It's going to be amazing.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: It's a party celebrating me and my fantastic cutie mark. How could it *not* be?

speaker: Diamond Tiara
Silver Spoon
text: Bump! Bump! Sugar-lump, rump! [laughing]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Gimme a break.

speaker: Silver Spoon
text: See you this weekend...

speaker: Diamond Tiara
Silver Spoon
text: *Blank flanks*! [laughing]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: It's not fair! It's just not fair!

speaker: Applejack
text: Don't get your mane in a tangle. You'll get your cutie mark. Everypony gets one eventually.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But I don't want one *eventually*! I want one *right now*! I can't go to Diamond Tiara's cute-ceañera without one, I just can't!

speaker: Applejack
text: 'Course you can. Y'know, I was the last pony in *my* class to get my cutie mark, and I couldn't be prouder of it. I knew my future was to run Sweet Apple Acres, and these bright shiny apples sealed the deal. [gasp] Come to think of it, Granny Smith was the last one in her class, too. Huh, same as Big McIntosh.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I really don't see how *that's* supposed to make me feel better. It probably means that being the last one in your class to get a cutie mark runs in the family. ...runs in the family. Runs in the family! Runs in the family! You've got *apples* for your cutie mark, Granny Smith has an *apple pie*, Big McIntosh has an *apple half*, my unique talent must has som'n to do with apples! Apples apples apples! [crash] Oops... apples.

speaker: Applejack
text: Get your delicious, nutritious apples here!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Delicious *and*nutritious, and *so many uses*! [chomp] You can eat 'em. [gulp] Play with 'em. [groan]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Create fine art for your home with 'em. You have to be crazy not to get a bushel of your very own.

speaker: Applejack
text: Heh... she's so creative, heh.

text: You, sir, care t' buy some apples?

text: No thanks.

text: Why not?

text: I have plenty at home.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Are you *sure*?

text: Yes, I'm pretty sure I...

speaker: Dr Hooves
text: Y...ah... If I buy some apples, will you please leave me alone?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: All right!

speaker: Applejack
text: You forgot your change!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Woo-hoo! That's how you sell s'm apples and get a cutie mark! So, what does my cutie mark look like? A shoppin' bag full of apples? A satisfied customer eating an apple? Hmm... maybe I gotta increase my sales figures first. You touch it, you buy it! We take cash or credit.

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry, ma'am. Ma'am! Aww... Now Apple Bloom, you can't just...

text: That'll be four bits.

text: I didn't put those in my bag.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Likely story. Four bits, lady!

speaker: Applejack
text: Apple Bloom! I am really really sorry about that. She's new. Here, take these. No charge. And these. And these.

speaker: Applejack
text: Y'all come back now, y'hear?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: What?

speaker: Applejack
text: Sorry, little sis, but your apple-sellin' days are over.

speaker: Apple Bloom

speaker: Applejack
text: Home. Now.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Hm.

speaker: Applejack
text: Ugh. Listen, sugarcube, I know it's hard to wait for your very own cutie mark, but, you just can't force it. Besides, you're not that grown-up just yet. Ain't there other fillies in your class without one?

text: Well... Twist doesn't have *hers* yet.

text: Do you think you'd feel better if you went to the party with her?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well there you go. Bet you and Twist would have a great time together. Now run along and find your friend.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: You're sure you don't want me to stick around 'til the end of th' market?

speaker: Ace
text: Hey! Who's been using my racket?

speaker: Applejack
text: Yeah. I'm sure.

speaker: Twist
text: Oh, what's up, Apple Bloom?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: So I was thinkin'... maybe we could go to Diamond Tiara's cute-ceañera together. I don't have a cutie mark, you don't have a cutie mark.

speaker: Twist
text: Well, um...

speaker: Twist
text: Isn't my cutie mark swell? I've always loved making my own favorite sweets, but it took me some time to discover that it was my super-special talent. Pretty sweet, huh?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Yeah, pretty... sweet.

text: Hey... this doesn't mean we can't go to the cute-ceañera together. You're still gonna come to the party, are you?

text: Of course she will.

text: It's not like being the only pony there without a cutie mark would be, like, the most embarrassing thing ever. [laughter]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Whoa, looks like somepony's got a dark cloud hanging over her head. Let *me* do something about that. What's the matter, kid?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [inhales] There's a cute-ceañera this afternoon and everypony in my class will be there and they'll all have their cutie marks and I wanna get my cutie mark but I'm no good at sellin' apples but I really wanna go to the party but how can I go to the party if I don't have my cutie mark which my big sister says I'm gonna get eventually but... I WANT IT NOW!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Cutie mark? I can get you a cutie mark like that! [snap]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Applejack says these things take time. I have to just wait for it to happen.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Why wait for something to happen when you can *make* it happen?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But Applejack says th...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Hey, who are you gonna listen to, Applejack, or the pony who was *first* in her class to get a cutie mark? I always liked flying an' all, but I was going nowhere in a hurry. It wasn't until my very first race that I discovered a serious need for speed, and KAZAM, this sweet baby appeared as fast as lightning.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's right, stretch out those legs. Gotta be nice and loose. The key here is to try as many things as possible as *quickly* as possible. One of them is bound to lead to your cutie mark. Are you ready?

text: I'm ready!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I said: Are! You! Ready!

text: I'M READY!

text: Ah!

text: Hang-gliding, go! [whistle blows]

text: Whoa!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Karate, go! [whistle blows]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Hi-ya! Ee...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Kite-flying, go! [whistle blows]

speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Whoaaa! Whoa...

text: Tried that one... tried that one... tried that one...

text: I love being special.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Tried that one... tried *that* one...

text: [gasp] But you look like you'd be good at helping me *make* some.

text:
All you have to do is take a cup of flour!
Add it to the mix!
Now just take a little something sweet, not sour!
A bit of salt, just a pinch!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
Baking these treats is such a cinch!
Add a teaspoon of vanilla!
Add a little more, and you count to four,
And you never get your fill of...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text:
Cupcakes! So sweet and tasty!
Cupcakes! Don't be too hasty!
Cupcakes! Cupcakes, cupcakes, CUPCAKES!

text: [cough] Hot, hot, hot!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [blow] Flour. It's flour! Yay! I guessed it. What game you wanna play next? Please say bingo, please say bingo.

text: [inhales] Tiara's cute-ceañera's today and everypony in my class will be there and they'll all have their cutie marks and I want to get my cutie mark but I'm no good at selling apples or hang-gliding or making cupcakes, but I wanna go to the party but how can I go to the party if I don't have my cutie mark, which Pinkie Pie says I can't just make appear, but I *need* it to appear, right now!

text: Please Twilight, jus' trah.

text: I'm sorry, but-

text: Oh please, please, please please *please*!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: All right, all right!

text: Oh thank you thank you *thank you*. [pwing] Yes! I knew you could do... it.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm sorry, sweetie, but I told you-

text: Try again, try again!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Told you that not even magic can make a cutie mark appear before its time.

text: It's hopeless, hopeless! I just won't go to the party, I can't go. Everyone will just laugh at me and make fun of me and call me names. It will be the worst night of my life.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm sure it won't be as bad as all that.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Forget it, there's no way I'm going to that [gulp] party.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: How could I have forgotten the time? How could I have forgotten Pinkie Pie was hosting the party? How could I have forgotten it was at Sugarcube Corner?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't forget your party hat, Forgetty Forgetterson!

text: I have to get out of here before anypony sees me.

text: Hey! It's *my* cute-ceañera, *I'm* supposed to get the first bite at cake.

speaker: Applejack
text: Apple Bloom, you made it. After I heard about Twist, I was afraid you wouldn't show up. I sure am glad you came to your senses about this whole cutie mark thing. These things happen when these things are supposed to happen. Trying to rush 'em just drives you crazy. I'll let you be, looks like your friends want to talk to you.

text: Well well well, look who's here.

text: Nice outfit.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Just sumt'n I, uh, pulled together last minute.

text: Uh, I have a cutie mark.

text: Since... Um... Earlier today.

text: I shouldn't. I couldn't. My cutie mark is so unbelievably amazing, I'm afraid that if I show it off, everyone will start paying attention to *me* instead of *you*. Outshined at your own cute-ceañera. Can you imagine how embarrassing that would be?

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Uh, forget it, I didn't really want to see it anyway.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Okay, well, I'm gonna go mingle. Enjoy your party. [sigh]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh no.

speaker: Diamond Tiara
text: Nice try...

speaker: Diamond Tiara
Silver Spoon

text: I said, you got a problem with blank flanks?

text: The problem is, I mean, she's like, totally not special.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: No, it means she's full of potential.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: It means she could be great at *anything*. The possibilities are, [mocking] like, endless.

text: She could be a great scientist, or an amazing artist, or a famous writer. She could even be mayor of Ponyville someday.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: And she's not stuck being *stuck-up* like you two.

text: Hey, this is *my* party, why are you two on *her* side?

text: Because...

text: [gasp] You don't have your cutie marks *either*? I thought I was the only one.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: We thought *we* were the only *two*.

text: I for one think you are three very lucky fillies.

text: They still get to experience the thrill of discovering who they are, and what they're meant to be.

speaker: Applejack

text: Not now, Silver Spoon.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Name's Scootaloo.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Apple Bloom.

speaker: Twist
text: This song is so super!

text: So I was thinking, now that we're friends... I mean, we are friends, right?

text: How could we not be? We're totally alike. We don't have cutie marks, Diamond Tiara and Silver Spoon drive us crazy--

text: *Totally* crazy.

text: Well, now that we're friends, what if the three of us work together to find out who we are and what we're supposed to be?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Ooh! Ooh! We could form our own secret society.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: I'm liking this idea.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: The Cutie Mark Three?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: The Cutastically Fantastics?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: It's perfect!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: This is gonna be so great!

text: We're gonna be *unstoppable*!

text: What do you say we celebrate with some of these delicious cupcakes?

text: Let's see if there are any cookies.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Yeah! Come on.

text: *Dearest Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *I am happy to report that one of your youngest subjects has learned a valuable lesson about friendship. Sometimes, the thing you think will cause you to lose friends and feel left out...*

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: *...can actually be the thing that helps you make your closest friends and realize how special you are.* Hmm...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [grunt] Whoo-hoo!

speaker: Applejack
text: Hoo-wee! Not a bad pitch for a pony who works with her head in the clouds.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh *yeah*? Think you can do better, cowgirl?

speaker: Applejack
text: I *know* I can. [grunt] Oh, for Pete's sake!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Heh! Looks like this Pegasus can pitch better than the workhorse. The object of the game is to get the *closest* to the stake.

speaker: Applejack
text: All right, all right. You got another throw there, pony girl.

speaker: Applejack
text: [sarcastically] Wow, Rainbow, heh. You couldn't hit a barn door with that kind of a throw!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, yeah. I still have the closest throw, Apple*smack*. Just try and beat it.

speaker: Applejack
text: [grunt] Yee-haw! It's a ringer. That's how you do it down here on the farm.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I lost.

speaker: Applejack
text: Ah, don't feel bad, Rainbow. It's all in good fun.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I *hate* losing.

text: Besides, you're a mighty good athlete. I'm just better. Heh heh heh.

text: Well, I was gonna say in all of Equestria, but that might be gildin' the lily.

text: ...and I think I'm the top athlete. So let's prove it.

text: *I* challenge *you* to an Iron Pony competition. A series of athletic contests to decide who's the best, *once and for all*.

text: You know what, Rainbow? You're *on*.

text: So you two are doing what, now?

speaker: Applejack
text: An Iron—

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Iron Pony competition.

speaker: Applejack
text: See, we've set up a bunch of events to decide which one of us is—

speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: And I'm here to...?

text: Right, heh. Somepony's gotta record my awesomeness for the history books. [grunt]

text: Uh, Spike, who are you talking to?

text: Um... Uh, them! Let the games *begin*!

text: Ready. Set. *Go*!

speaker: Applejack
text: [gasp] Dagnabbit.

text: Time, Spike?

text: 17 seconds.

text: You're kiddin'! That breaks my record from last year's rodeo.

text: But you got a five second penalty for nudging the barrel.

speaker: Applejack
text: [sigh] *Nuts and chews*! Still, that's 22 seconds. Not too shabby. Hey, don't be nervous. Remember, it's all in good fun. Now git on up there.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Ready. Set. Go!

speaker: Applejack
text: Woo! That was some *fancy* hoofwork there, Rainbow!

text: Mighty respectable, [spit] but let me show ya how it's *really* done. [grunt] [bell rings]

text: Years of applebuckin'.

text: Ugh.

text: Waa-hoo!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Go*!

speaker: Spike
text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-hoa! Whoa! Whoaaa! Ouch.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Ready for another pony ride?

speaker: Spike
text: *No*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Go*!

speaker: Spike
text: Guh guh guh guh guh guh guh guh guh guh guh guhwhoaaaaaa!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Rainbow Dash wins the bronco-buck.

speaker: Spike
text: And I *lose*.

speaker: Spike
text: Whoa! [grunt] How do I get roped into these things?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [grunt] Does this count?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Yuh*! [blows raspberry]

speaker: Applejack
text: [grunt] *Wah*!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Yeah.*

speaker: Spike
text: *Fillies and gentlecolts*, at the halfway point, our competitors are tied at five and five.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Who are you talking to?

speaker: Spike
text: Them!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Yes*!

speaker: Applejack
text: *Be a good sport, Applejack*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: All right, you two. This is the final event. Give it *all you've got*.

speaker: Spike
text: Looks like the workhorse might come out ahead in this one.

speaker: Applejack
text: [mumbling] That's not fair. You can't use your wings to help you win.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Huh?

speaker: Applejack
text: [mumbling] You're cheatin'!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I can't understand you with that rope in your mouth.

speaker: Applejack
text: [spits] I *said*... uh-oh. [grunt]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Whoo-hoo! I win by a landslide... or *mudslide* in your case. [chuckles] I am the Iron Pony!

speaker: Applejack
text: Only 'cause you cheated.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *What*?

speaker: Applejack
text: You used your wingpower to help you win over half those contests.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sounds like sour apples to me.

speaker: Applejack
text: Are you sayin' you *didn't* use your wings?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well... no. But you never said I *couldn't* use my wings.

speaker: Applejack
text: I didn't think I needed to tell you to *play fair*.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I still would have won even *without* my wings.

speaker: Applejack
text: Hah! *Prove* it.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Gladly. How?

speaker: Applejack
text: Tomorrow is the annual Runnin' of the Leaves. I challenge you to *race* me in it.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Heh! Easy shmeasy.

speaker: Applejack
text: Hold on! There is *one* condition: the point is to *run*, so no wings allowed.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No wings? No problem.

speaker: Spike
text: Twilight, *hurry up*, we're gonna be late for the race.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Why are *you* so excited about the race? It's only for ponies.

speaker: Spike
text: Yeah, but I'm hoping I can be the announcer again. Just listen: Fillies and gentlecolts, welcome to the annual Running of the--

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Welcome to the annual Running of the Leaves! This is Pinkie Pie, your official p-eye-in-the-sky announcer.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Sorry, Spike. I guess that job's already taken.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: As everypony knows, the Running is a very important tradition, for without it, the autumn leaves of Equestria would *never* fall. So get ready, ponies. The Running of the Leaves will begin in *five minutes*.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Pardon me, excuse me. Make way for the Iron Pony.

speaker: Applejack
text: The Iron *Phony*, you mean.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: So, Applejack, you ready to win *second* place?

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm ready to run a good, *clean* race.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, yeah...

speaker: Applejack
text: You are *not* allowed to use your wings.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I could win this race with both wings tied behind my back.

speaker: Applejack
text: [grunts] Trussed up like a turkey. Well, a turkey who can't fly, that is.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Very funny.

speaker: Applejack
text: 'Least now we know we're racin' fair and square.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Racers! Please take your positions!

speaker: Spike
text: Um... Pinkie Pie?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hey, Spike! What's up? Oh wait, it's me! I'm up! [laughs]

speaker: Spike
text: Uh, yeah. I know you're doing the announcing today and stuff and... I'm sure you're gonna do a great job and all, but... I was just wondering...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *What*?

speaker: Spike
text: Aw... Forget it.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Spike! Would you like to be my co-reporter? We could comment on the action *together*.

speaker: Spike
text: We *could*?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Climb on up*.

speaker: Applejack
text: Twilight? What in tarnation are you doin' up here?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm racing.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [laughs] Good one, Twilight.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm not joking.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *What*? You're not an athlete, you're a... well... you're an egghead.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I am *not* an egghead, I am well-read.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [softly] *Egghead*.

speaker: Applejack
text: [snickers] But have you ever run a race?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, no, but I do know a lot *about* running.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: And you know this from...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Books. I've read several on the subject.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What'd you read, "The Egghead's Guide to Running"? Did you stretch out your eye muscles to warm up? [laugh] Get it? *Eye muscles*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Scoff if you must, Rainbow. But the Running of the Leaves is a Ponyville tradition, and since I'm here to learn, I've decided I should experience it myself.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, I think that's just dandy, Twilight. Good luck. [snickers]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah. See you at the finish line... Tomorrow.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: All right, ponies, are you ready?

speaker: Spike
text: *Get set*.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And they're off!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Welcome to the official coverage of the Running of the Leaves! You know, Spike, despite its name, the leaves don't do *any* of the actual running. No, that's left to my little ponies.

speaker: Spike
text: Why, yes, Pinkie, it's the running of the ponies that causes the leaves to fall.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ugh. Those lazy, lazy leaves. But this year, the run is about more than the weather. It's about the race to the finish and the two runners who want to win it: Applejack and Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Spike
text: You know, Pinkie, these two ponies have a bit of a grudge match they're trying to settle. Trying to prove who's the most athletic.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yes, and "grudge" rhymes with "fudge".

speaker: Spike
text: Yes, it... does. *What*?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And I like fudge. But if I eat too much fudge I get a pudge and then I can't budge.

speaker: Spike
text: So... no fudge?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, no thanks. I had a big breakfast. Let's check in with our two competitive ponies, Applejack and Rainbow Dash. Having come fast out of the gate, Applejack and Rainbow Dash are evenly matched running neck and neck. But what's this? Applejack is making a move, she's now ahead by a nose. But Rainbow Dash won't let Applejack have it and takes the lead. *She's* ahead by half a nose. Or maybe three quarters of a nose. No, about sixty-three point seven percent of a nose... roughly speaking. Applejack sees this move and pushes forth with her strong workhorse legs slinking ahead by three hundred and fifty noses!

speaker: Applejack
text: Not so easy without wings, is it?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Come on, Rainbow. Show 'em a little *dash*.

speaker: Spike
text: Ho-hold your horses, Pinkie! Rainbow Dash is catching up the frontrunner Applejack!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: What an *upset*. I thought Applejack had this in the bag.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You didn't think I was gonna let you off that easily, did you?

speaker: Applejack
text: *Whoa*! I don't believe it.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I know, it's beautiful, isn't it?

speaker: Applejack
text: Not the scenery, Twilight. Rainbow Dash just tripped me.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: She did not.

speaker: Applejack
text: She did too!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: She did *not*, and if you slowed down and looked where you're going, like me, you'd see that you tripped over a rock.

speaker: Applejack
text: What? Oh, hayseed! Now I got a lot of ground to make up to catch Rainbow.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Just be careful!

speaker: Applejack
text: See you at the finish line!

speaker: Spike
text: I don't believe it. After a huge setback, Applejack is back at the front of the pack.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: She's the head of the pack, all right. The pick of the litter! The cat's pajamas! Oh wait, why would Applejack take some poor kitty's PJs? That's not very sporting of her.

speaker: Spike
text: Oookay... Let's get back to the race.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Not so fast, Applejack! This race isn't over yet!

speaker: Applejack
text: It is for you. Heh.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Whoa*! Guh, I don't believe it, Applejack tripped me.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Don't you ponies ever look where you're going? You tripped on a stump. See?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh, I see. A big cheater is what *I* see.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Rainbow, Applejack would never cheat. It was just an accident.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sure it was. I mean, yeah, I'm sure it was.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Remember, Rainbow, this is just a game.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Yes, but the rules have changed, and two can play at that game.*

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Welcome back, Ponyvillians, it's me, Pinkie Pie.

speaker: Spike
text: And Spike. Looks like Rainbow is doing her best to catch up.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I'm not sure how ketchup is going to help her in this contest. Now, in a hot dog eating contest it can make them doggies nice and slippery, but personally, I prefer mustard. How about you, Spike?

speaker: Spike
text: Uh... I... like... pickles?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Aaand it looks like Applejack has found *her*self in quite a pickle as Rainbow overtakes her.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Look, ma, no wings*.

speaker: Spike
text: As the racers enter Equestria's Whitetail Wood, Rainbow Dash is back in the lead.

speaker: Applejack
text: Ugh. Hey, *Rainbow*!

speaker: Applejack
text: [gasp] Why, that little cheater did that on purpose. It's *on*.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *Nice one, Rainbow.*

speaker: Applejack
text: Later!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [gasp] Aaa!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh my, Whitetail Wood is just lovely. Hey, Rainbow, shouldn't you be up ahead?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [chuckling] I'm sure I'll win now.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Except that the other racers just passed you.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh horse apples... See ya!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Applejack, what are you doing up here?

speaker: Spike
text: There aren't even any trees.

speaker: Applejack
text: Er, no, but the sign's pointed this way... *Rainbow*. Mind giving me a lift?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What the hay?! You said no flying!

speaker: Applejack
text: No, I said no wings.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I must say, Spike, that this has been the most interesting Running of the Leaves in Equestria history!

speaker: Spike
text: *With the most interesting announcing*.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But it isn't the running that's been fascinating. It's the *lack* of running!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [grunt] Aaa!

speaker: Applejack
text: Whoa!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Whoa!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Forgive me, girls. I know I'm not an athlete, but shouldn't the Running of the Leaves actually involve *running*?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You know, I think Twilight's right.

speaker: Applejack
text: You do?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah! If you wanna beat me, you better... RUUUN!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Once again, Rainbow Dash and Applejack are neck and neck, jockeying for position. Applejack inches ahead, now it's Rainbow, it's Applejack, it's Rainbow Dash, it's Applejack--

speaker: Spike
text: Oh no, she di'int!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh yes, she di'id!

speaker: Applejack
text: Cut it out!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No, you cut it out!

speaker: Applejack
text: You started it.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: And now I'm gonna finish it.

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh no, you won't.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh yes, I will. [grunt] That's it! All bets are off!

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh no, you don't.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: It's Applejack, it's Rainbow Dash, it's Applejack, it's Rainbow Dash--

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I won!

speaker: Applejack
text: No, *I* won!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: *I* won!

speaker: Spike
text: You tied!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
Applejack
text: Tied?!

speaker: Applejack
text: For first?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: For last!

speaker: Applejack
text: Last?!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Then who won?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
Applejack
text: You?!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh no, but I did get fifth place, which is rather good considering I've never run a race before.

speaker: Applejack
text: What? How's that even possible?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You ran *so slow*, and *looked at the scenery*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Exactly. I paced myself, just like my book said. Then at the end, when all the other ponies were worn out, I sprinted to the finish.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I don't believe it. *Twilight* beat us.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, with all your horsing around, it was quite easy.

speaker: Applejack
text: You're right, Twilight. Our behavior was just terrible.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: We weren't very good sports.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Sounds to me that an important lesson was learned.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
Applejack
text: Princess Celestia?!

speaker: Applejack
text: W-What are you doin' here?

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Fall is one of my favorite seasons, so I came to celebrate the Running of the Leaves.

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry you had to see us being such poor sports, Princess.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: That's all right, Applejack. *Anypony can get swept up in the excitement of competition.*

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *It's important to remember that the*friendship*is always more important than the competition.*

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Exactly, Twilight. Now, unfortunately, because the two of you were busy tricking each other instead of shaking down leaves, many of the lovely trees of Equestria are still covered.

speaker: Applejack
text: Why, Princess, I bet we can knock those leaves down for you lickety-split. Whaddya say, friend? Wanna go for another run?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I'd love to stretch my legs.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Opalescence. Can't you just picture it? *Moi*, stepping out in a stunning new gown at the Grand Galloping Gala in Canterlot!

speaker: Rarity
text: Why, yes! I did make it myself. Thank you so much for asking.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Opal, of course you can help me. Thank you. What's that? You want to help me more? Oh, aren't you the sweetest thing? Careful now. Don't move. This shouldn't take long at all.

speaker: Applejack
text: Howdy, Rarity!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Shh... Can't you see Rarity is trying to concentrate?

speaker: Applejack
text: What do you think she's makin'?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Looks like a dress.

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, that makes sense. Since this is a dressmaker's shop and all.

speaker: Rarity
text: Is there something I can help you with?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, so very sorry to trouble you, Rarity, but I need a quick favor. Could you please fix the button for me? It's my dress for the Grand Galloping Gala.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, no, no, no! You can't wear this... old thing. You need a glamorous new outfit for the Gala and I'll make it for you. No problem at all. It will be my pleasure!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, that's really sweet of you to offer, Rarity, but I can't let you do that. It would be so much work. This dress is fine.

speaker: Rarity
text: Twilight Sparkle. I insist on making you a new dress.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: But...

speaker: Rarity
text: Not another word! I won't take no for an answer.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, in that case... Thank you for your generosity, Rarity. Knowing your handiwork, I'm sure it will be absolutely beautiful.

speaker: Rarity
text: Let me guess, Applejack. You don't want a new gown either.

speaker: Applejack
text: Gown? Shoot. I was just gonna wear my old work duds.

speaker: Rarity
text: You can't possibly be serious, Applejack! You absolutely must wear formal attire.

speaker: Applejack
text: Hm... Nah.

speaker: Rarity
text: What if I just spruce up your... duds for you a little bit?

speaker: Applejack
text: Okay, sure. Why not? Since you're up for it and all. Just don't make them too... frou-frou-y.

speaker: Rarity
text: Deal!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Look out below!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Sorry. New trick. Didn't quite work.

speaker: Rarity
text: Hmm... [gasp] Idea! I'll make you an outfit for the Gala too, Rainbow Dash.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Outfit for the what now?

speaker: Rarity
text: I'll make one for you and you and all of you. Oh! And of course Pinkie and Fluttershy too. Oh, and when I'm done, we can hold our very own fashion show!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What a great idea! If you're sure you can handle it.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, it'll be a little bit of work, but it will be a wonderful boost for my business. Plus, fun!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Oh, I love fun things!

speaker: Rarity
text: Then it's settled. We'll have a fashion show starring us.

speaker: Applejack
text: So all you have to do is make a different, stunning, original, amazing outfit for one, two, three, four, five... plus yourself, six ponies? And lickety split?

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Applejack. You make it sound as if it's going to be hard.

speaker: Rarity
text:
Thread by thread, stitching it together
Twilight's dress, cutting out the pattern snip by snip
Making sure the fabric folds nicely
It's the perfect color and *so* hip
Always gotta keep in mind my pacing
Making sure the clothes' correctly facing
I'm stitching Twilight's dress

speaker: Rarity
text:
Yard by yard, fussing on the details
Jewel neckline, don't you know a stitch in time saves nine?
Make her something perfect to inspire
Even though she hates formal attire
Gotta mind those intimate details
Even though she's more concerned with sales
It's Applejack's new dress

speaker: Rarity
text:
Dressmaking's easy, for Pinkie Pie something pink
Fluttershy something breezy
Blend color and form,
*[To Opalescence]* Do you think it looks cheesy?

speaker: Rarity
text:
Something brash, perhaps quite fetching
Hook and eye, couldn't you just simply die?
Making sure it fits forelock and crest
Don't forget some magic in the dress
Even though it rides high on the flank
Rainbow won't look like a tank
I'm stitching Rainbow's dress

speaker: Rarity
text:
Piece by piece, snip by snip
Croup, dock, haunch, shoulders, hip
Thread by thread, primmed and pressed
Yard by yard, never stressed
And that's the art of the dress!

speaker: Rarity
text: That's it. Keep them closed. Don't look. Okay, you can look now!

speaker: Rarity
text: These are your new outfits. What do you think of your old duds now, Applejack? Pretty swanky, are they not? And Twilight! I made this dress for you and I designed each outfit theme to perfectly reflect each pony's unique personality. Oh, it took me forever to get the colors right on this one, Rainbow Dash, but I did it. Oh, and it turned out *beautiful*, don't you think? And I know you are going to love yours, Fluttershy. It just sings spring! And Pinkie Pie, look! Pink! Your favorite! Aren't they all amazing?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Wow... They're...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, they're...

speaker: Applejack
text: They sure are... somethin'.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Yes! Something.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I love something! Something is my favorite!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: It's... nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: But what's the matter? Don't you like them?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: They're very nice...

speaker: Applejack
text: And we're plumb grateful 'cause you worked so hard on them.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Mine's just not as cool as I was imagining. She asked.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I guess what we're all saying is that they're just not what we had in mind.

speaker: Rarity
text: That's okay. Not a problem. There's plenty more where that came from. They were only a first pass. You're my friends and I want you to be 110% satisfied. Not to worry, I'll redo them.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, Rarity. You don't have to do that. They're fine.

speaker: Rarity
text: I want them to be better than just fine. I want you to think they're absolutely perfect.

speaker: Applejack
text: Are you sure? I mean, we wouldn't wanna impose.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, it's no imposition. Really, I insist.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, in that case... Thank you again, Rarity.

speaker: Rarity
text: What have I gotten myself into?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Hello? You wanted to see me, Rarity?

speaker: Rarity
text: Fluttershy! Your new-new gown's ready. I completely revised it and I know you're going to love it. What do you think?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I... love it.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, you're just saying that.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No, no. I do. It's... nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: "Nice"?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: If you don't like it, you should just tell me.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Oh, but I do like it.

speaker: Rarity
text: Like it or love it?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Um... both?

speaker: Rarity
text: Which is it?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Please stop asking me this, I...

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, just tell me what you really think.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No, that's okay...

speaker: Rarity
text: Tell me.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: No... it's fine...

speaker: Rarity
text: Tell me!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I... like it...

speaker: Rarity
text: Tell me, tell me, tell-me-tell-me-tell-me!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: All right! Since you really wanna know... [inhales] The armscye's tight, the middy collar doesn't go with the shawl lapel, the hems are clearly machine-stitched, the pleats are uneven, the fabric looks like toile, you used a backstitch here when it clearly called for a topstitch or maybe a traditional blanket stitch, and the overdesign is reminiscent of prêt-à-porter and not true French haute couture. [pauses] But, uh... you know... um, whatever you want to do is fine.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Now, the stars on my belt need to be technically accurate. Orion has three stars on his belt, not four.

speaker: Rarity
text:
Stitch by stitch, stitching it together
Deadline looms, don't you know the client's always right?
Even if my fabric choice was perfect
Gotta get them all done by tonight
Pinkie Pie, that color's too obtrusive
Wait until you see it in the light
I'm sewing them together!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Don't you think my gown would be more "*me*" with some lollipops?

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, I think...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Balloons?

speaker: Rarity
text: Well...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Do it!

speaker: Rarity
text:
Hour by hour, one more change
I'm sewing them together, take great pains
Fluttershy, you're putting me in a bind
Rainbow Dash, what is on your mind?
Oh my gosh, there's simply not much time
Don't forget, Applejack's duds must shine

speaker: Rarity
text:
Dressmaking's easy, every customer's call
Brings a whole new revision
Have to pick up the pace, still hold to my vision

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: That constellation is Canis Major, not Minor.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: French haute couture, please.

speaker: Rarity
text: Ugh...

speaker: Applejack
text: What if it rains? Galoshes!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: More balloons! Oh no, that's too many balloons. More candy! Oh, less candy. Oh wait, I know. Streamers!

speaker: Rarity
text: Streamers?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whose dress is this?

speaker: Rarity
text: Streamers it is.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What?

speaker: Rarity
text: Aren't you going to tell me to change something too?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: No, I just want my dress to be cool.

speaker: Rarity
text: Do you not like the color?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: The color's fine, just make it look cooler.

speaker: Rarity
text: Do you not like the shape?

speaker: Rainbow Dash

Got to overcome intimidation

text:
Piece by piece, snip by snip
Croup, dock, haunch, shoulders, hip
Bolt by bolt, primmed and pressed
Yard by yard, always stressed
And that's the art of the dress!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Opal. These are the ugliest dresses I've ever made.

speaker: Rarity
text: Okay. I did exactly what each of you asked for. Now don't hold back. Let me know what you really think.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh my!

Rainbow Dash
Applejack
Pinkie Pie

text: It's exactly what I asked for!

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, I'm... happy that all of you are happy. I'm just relieved to finally be done.

speaker: Spike
text: You are never gonna believe this! You've heard of Hoity Toity?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The bigwig fashion hotshot in Canterlot?

speaker: Spike
text: Uh-huh. He heard about your fashion show. Well, maybe I happened to mention it to him... He's coming here all the way from Canterlot to see your work, Rarity!

speaker: Applejack
text: Whoa, Nelly! You could sell a ton o' dresses to this guy. Your business will be boomin'!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Wow!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's so cool!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I don't believe it!

speaker: Rarity
text: Hoity Toity? He's coming here? To see THESE dresses?

speaker: Spike
text: Yep! Get ready for all of your dreams to come true.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh. [gasp] There he is! [deep breaths] Okay. Relax, Rarity. Your friends like their outfits and so will he. [squeals] What's wrong with the lights?! Oh, yes. That means the show's starting. Good.

speaker: Spike
text: Since the beginning of time, the elite of Equestria have longed for pony fashions that truly expressed the essence of their very souls. Patiently waiting decades -- no, *centuries* -- for the perfect pony gown. Today, at long last, Equestria, your wait is over! Let's hear it for the breathtaking designs of Ponyville's own Rarity!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh dear.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You think we overdid it?

speaker: Applejack
text: Nah. [pause] Okay, maybe a little.

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Oh, those amateurish designs look like a piled-on mishmash of everything but a kitchen sink! It's a travesty is what it is. Those outfits are the ugliest things I've ever seen, oh for shame. Who is responsible for subjecting our eyes to these horrors? Not to mention wasting my valuable time.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh! Hide me.

speaker: Spike
text: Come on out and take a bow, Rarity. You worked really hard for this. Yes! All right, woo-hoo! Go, Rarity!

text: Rarity? You okay in there? You haven't come out for days.

speaker: Rarity
text: I'm never coming out! I can't show my face in Ponyville ever again! I used to be somepony. I used to be respected. I made dresses. Beautiful, beautiful dresses! But now everypony is laughing at me. I'm nothing but a laughing stock! [sobs]

text: You're not a laughing stock, Rarity...

text: Shhh! Come on out and talk to us.

text: [sobbing] Leave me alone! I vant to be alone! I want to wallow in... whatever it is that ponies are supposed to wallow in! Do ponies wallow in pity? Oh, listen to me, I don't even know what I'm supposed to wallow in! I'm so pathetic!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Now what do we do?

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Uh... panic?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: That's your answer for everything!

speaker: Applejack

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Give her time.

speaker: Rarity
text: Exile... I guess technically I'd have to move away to live in exile. Where would I go? And what would I pack? Oh, it's going to take me forever to do all of that packing. What are you supposed to pack when you go to exile? Are you supposed to pack warm?

speaker: Rarity
text: Huh? Opal?

speaker: Rarity
text: Opal, how did you get up there? Hang on, you poor dear! Mama's coming!

speaker: Rarity
text: What is it? It's not... You... [gasp]

text: We all finished your dress for you.

speaker: Applejack
text: Thanks to Fluttershy's freaky knowledge of sewing.

text: Do you like it?

text: Like it? Like it?!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Uh-uh. She doesn't like it.

speaker: Rarity
text: No, I don't like it.

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Applejack
Pinkie Pie

text: I love it!

speaker: Fluttershy
Rainbow Dash
Applejack
Pinkie Pie
Twilight Sparkle
text: Yay!

text: You ponies did an amazing job. It's exactly the way I imagined it.

text: We just followed your brilliant design.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Like we should have let you do for our outfits. Those first dresses you designed were perfect.

text: We're so super sorry.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: You worked really hard to make our dresses exactly the way we wanted them. We all saw how well that turned out.

text: Hello... Oh, this can't be the same designer.

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Simply magnificent! And I suddenly have a fierce craving for some Dutch apple pie, candied apples on a stick, apple turnovers, apple cobbler...

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Brilliant!

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Oh, spectacular!

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Now this is a fashion show! All of these dresses are absolutely amazing. Who is responsible? Step forward, show yourself!

text: Brava! Brava! Magnifico! Encore!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, thank you. Thank you! Oh, thank you so much!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Dear Princess Celestia,*

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *This week, my very talented friend Rarity learned that if you try to please everypony, you often times end up pleasing nopony, especially yourself. And*I*learned this: when somepony offers to do you a favor, like making you a beautiful dress, you shouldn't be overly critical of something generously given to you. In other words, you shouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth.* [giggles]

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Rarity, my congratulations to you on a most impressive fashion debut. Would you do me the great honor of allowing me to feature your couture in my Best of the Best Boutique in Canterlot?

speaker: Hoity Toity
text: Now, I'll need you to make a dozen of each dress for me by next Tuesday.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Tuh! Nuh! Uh! Nyuh!

text: Eyes over here, Spike!

text: For this to work, it's crucial we keep our concentration totally on the-

text: Ooh!

text: Ugh, never mind her. She's just being Pinkie Pie.

speaker: Spike
text: Super-*extra* Pinkie Pie today.

text: Pinkie Pie? What in the wide, wide world of Equestria are you up to?

text: Oh! It's my tail! It's my tail! It's a-twitch a-twitchin'! And you know what that means!

text: Actually, Pinkie, I haven't the slightest idea.

text: The twitchin' means my Pinkie Sense is telling me that stuff's gonna start falling! You two better duck for cover.

text: He just said "nice catch" in Frog.

text: Oh, I'm so, so sorry. You okay, Twilight Sparkle? I just couldn't stand to see the pond getting so over-populated, what with the frogs all hopping into each other and all, so I decided to fly as many as I can on over to Froggy Bottom Bogg.

text: I'll start a bath for you.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: Sooo, basically, it works like this: I get different, little, niggly feelings and they mean different things. Like when my back is itchy, it means it's my lucky day. And, when my knee gets pinchy, that means something scary's about to happen.

text: Ugh!

text: Oh no-no-no-no-no. You're thinking of an ear flop, then knee twitch, then eye flutter. This was an ear flop, *then* eye flutter, then knee twitch. That usually means "look out for opening doors". You okay?

text: Okie-dokie-lokie. [gasp] Uh-oh. [gasp] Hu-bu-bu-bu-buh!

text: [giggling] [sniff] Mmm... [giggling]

text: Ah!

text: Whoa-oh-uh!

text: [gasp] No! I'm doing scientific research. I'm observing Pinkie Pie, scientific name: Pinkius Pieicus, in its natural habitat.

text: Pinkius-whoicus? Hh!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: There's something fishy going on with the whole twitchy prediction thing, and I'm getting to the bottom of it. So, shh. Come on, Pinkius Pieicus is on the move.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Hm... Itchy nose...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Aha! *That* makes no sense. See? She's hiding like something's about to fall from the sky, but a *twitchy tail* means something's gonna fall from the sky, *not* an itchy nose.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: This proves...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: ...perhaps conclusively, that—

text: Spike! Where are you going? I'm trying to teach you the value of scientific—

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Probably that the flower smells *good*. Wait. I'm getting something. Ear flop, eye flutter, knee twitch.

speaker: Spike
text: Hold on... You told me that's the combo that says "watch out for opening doors"!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh-ho. You really, really believe this stuff, don't you? Here, let me show you there's nothing to be afraid of. You see? I promise you there's nothing to fear from that— Wo-o-ah! Ow! Ugh! Ow! Ow!

text: Twilight! You came to visit my new apple cellar, how nice. Twi? You okay? Uh, Twi?

text: Here, let me help you.

text: Ugh, Spike honestly, you're overreact—

text: Ugh!

text: [humming] Hey, Applejack. Whatcha doin'?

text: Takin' more apples to my new apple cellar. How 'bout you, Pinkie? Whatchu doin'?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: All done, clear skies from here on in, as far as I can tell— Hu-bu-bu-bu-bu-bu!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Dunno, never gotten any like it before, but whatever that shudder's about, it's a doozy. Something you'd never expect to happen is gonna happen! Hu-bu-bu-bu-bu hu-bu-bu-bu! And it's gonna happen... at Froggy Bottom Bogg!

text: [gasp] That's where Fluttershy's headed!

text: Uh, I'm not sure.

text: Calm down, everypony. All we know right now is that Pinkie Pie just got a case of the shivers. That's all.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I *don't*. I just want to be there to see the look on Pinkie's face when we find out nothing's wrong.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Okie-dokie!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [shivers] Hu-bu-bu-bu-bu-bu!

text: *Cold*? Need a jacket or something?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No thanks, I'm fine. [shivers] Hu-bu-bu-bu-bu-bu!

speaker: Applejack
text: I hope nothin'.

speaker: Spike
text: I know, but, whadda'ya think happened?

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm tryin' not to think about it.

speaker: Spike
text: *Me too*. But I'm thinkin' about it anyway. Like, what if she exploded?

speaker: Applejack
text: Just *exploded*? For no reason?

speaker: Spike
text: Yeah, like boom!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whoa!

speaker: Spike
text: I know.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: What if... What if she exploded, and then... and then exploded again!?

text: Can you do that? Can you explode twice?

text: Of course not.

text: But what if she exploded, and exploded again, and then— ugh!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Will you two *stop*? She's fine, I'm sure of it.

text: Fluttershy?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Fluttershy? [gasp]

text: Fluttershy! You're okay!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Of course.

text: I'm so glad everything's all right.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Sorry, I know it's not nice to gloat but... Aha! I told you there was nothing to worry about, and I was right. Pinkie Pie said whatever she was shuddering about was a [cough] doozy, and [cough] and the only [cough] doozy here is how right I am.

speaker: Applejack
text: Um... Twilight?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Pinkie's made a lot of predictions today but [cough] ugh, what is that smell? But what we've shown here is that there's no point in believing [cough] in anything you can't see for yourself.

text: Pinkie! Come on!

text: Ooph! [pant]

text: Oh, I'm *so* sorry.

text: Ah!

text: Everypony up that hill!

text: He-e-elp!

text: Coming, Spike! Hang on!

text: I think we're gonna make it.

text: Oh, lookie there, it stopped. O-h-h-h, t-h-e-r-e i-t i-s a-g-a-i-n.

text: Ugh, he'll be up here in no time! Quick, one at a time, cross!

text: Whoa-ho!

text: Whoa-oa-oa-oa-oa!

text: T-T-T-twilight!

text: T-T-T-twilight! You have to jump!
